page.title: 17 TRANSPORT:ROADS.
page.content: Through this area the main line of communication is the A51 road,which was once a main route from London to Chester and the north.In order to estimate its significance,a traffic flow survey was undertaken. From the results the number of vehicles using the road between 13.00 and 14.45 hours,indicated a high percentage of business and commercial usage.This included heavy goods lorries hauling a wide variety of products and many vans supplying local industries and residents. In terms of percentage the survey found that 35% of traffic was of industrial nature and 65% were private cars.However it can also be surmised that many of the cars were perhaps people involved in their day to day work.For example,sales people.
